Title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
Are you ready to change the market?

Are you a passionate and experienced Data Scientist, excited to work on improving and maintaining our data architecture? Join us to become a part of our strong international team that is transforming the traditional debt collection industry with innovation and a drive for excellence.

What You Can Do With Us


be part of our Data Science team to further optimize our innovative product based on machine learning and artificial intelligence
work on advanced and demanding AI fields such as reinforcement learning and LLMs
identify, understand, structure and solve complex problems in a driven and pragmatic manner
work on projects that deliver measurable value to our business
experiment with new technologies and acquire new skills to find clever solutions to the unique challenges we will encounter along the way
communicate between all stakeholders (data scientists, lead developers, product management, business owners) and present technical product concepts


What You Should Bring For It


degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar
8+ years experience as Data Scientist, ideally in a startup or fintech company
extensive experience with Python and with data processing packages (e.g. Pandas, Numpy) and machine learning frameworks (e.g. pytorch, scikit-learn, transformers)
familiarity with web frameworks like Flask or FastAPI
deep knowledge of relational databases such as MySQL or PostgreSQL
extensive and hands-on experience with deployment of (ideally open source) LLMs (hosting, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, evaluation)
experience with Reinforcement Learning would be a strong plus
impressive track-record of projects using ML to solve business problems
experience with agile development practices such as TDD/BDD, continuous integration, refactoring, code reviews, etc.
experience with cloud-based infrastructure solutions, such as AWS
excellent English speaking and writing skills
willingness to dive into our data and get your hands dirty


Transparency, Execution, Ownership, Customer Centricity, Innovation and Integrity are important to us and we at PAIR Finance embody these values. Do you find yourself in these values? Then become part of our team and complement us with your individual motivation and character!

Our Offer For You


We offer visa sponsorship
Thriving, financially stable company
Strong experienced international team to support and mentor you along the way, smooth onboarding process
International team of 30+ nationalities with professionals and experts
Flat hierarchy, transparent and appreciative feedback culture, monthly all hands meetings, annual feedback and evaluation cycle, regular 1-on-1s with your lead
Well-structured onboarding process as well as supportive and welcoming colleagues
Personal learning & development budget as well as German and English language courses
Good salary for your strong performance
Unlimited employment contract, flexible working hours and 28 vacation days for your work-life balance
Company pension plan, partly covered Deutschlandticket (public transport) and access to ‚ÄúCorporate Benefits‚Äù voucher platform to ensure your full well-being
Fun company summer and Christmas parties as well as regular team events
This role is based in Berlin, and we have a hybrid working policy. Modern office near Uhlandstra√üe is complete with fresh fruit, muesli and drinks for a comfortable and enjoyable workplace


Who is your contact person?

Your contact person for this position is Geneva Brooks. If you have any questions, please contact us directly by email (jobs@pairfinance.com). For more information about PAIR Finance, please take a look at our website and our careers page. We look forward to hearing from you!

About Us

We are rethinking debt collection with our digital debt collection solution, characterized by our high customer orientation and efficiency standards. By using artificial intelligence, we are combining technology with behavioral science and so we are able to contact customers individually and in a simple way throughout the entire collection process.

Strengthened by one of the most renowned private equity firms in the fintech sector, Pollen Street, as well as partnerships with other investors such as Zalando Payments and finleap, PAIR Finance offers an excellent opportunity to dive deep into and actively shape the fintech industry.

PAIR Finance is an equal-opportunity employer. We value a diverse team and an inclusive culture. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, or disability.

For more information about PAIR Finance, visit www.pairfinance.com/ and www.pairfinance.com/karriere/ and www.trustpilot.com/review/www.pairfinance.com

Do you want to find out more about PAIR Finance and the position? We are happy to answer your questions and also to receive your application!

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Campaigns
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to help us improve Bolt‚Äôs Campaigns

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 50+ countries. We‚Äôre a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission ‚Äì to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

You will be building models for predicting the probability of the user booking under specific circumstances. You will work on customer segmentation: discover rider, driver, and eater segments for efficient campaign targeting. As a Data Scientist, you will be developing a system for automating promo campaigns setup and scaling it for millions of Bolt customers. You will be engaged in designing optimal experimental setup for comparing different campaigns targeting methodologies and user behavior dynamics. You will work on prioritising user acquisition channels using analytical and machine learning approaches.

Your daily adventures will include:


Machine learning and statistical model development and its deployment into a production environment)
Studying historical user behaviour and building models for optimal users‚Äô discount allocation
Developing a system for automating regular promo campaign setups)
Setting up A/B tests, collecting, interpreting its results, and communicating to stakeholders)
Working with a technical stack consisting of Python, Docker, Presto, SageMaker, Airflow)
Collaborating with data analysts, data scientists, product managers, and software engineers in feature teams )



About you:


Industry experience in data science and machine learning (4+ years recommended), with deep knowledge of statistics, probability, and causal inference
Proficient in setting A/B tests and interpreting results, with a strong understanding of statistical hypothesis testing
Track record of deploying models to production and effectively measuring their impact
Experience in writing complex SQL queries and mapping business/product problems to data science frameworks
Strong product thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to communicate, persuade, and collaborate effectively
Proactive, self-driven mindset, able to take initiative with minimal supervision and work well in a team



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don‚Äôt tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you‚Äôre the kind of person described above!

Why you‚Äôll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50+ countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode with a minimum of 2 days in the office each week to foster strong connections and teamwork.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location and role.

Title: Senior ML Engineer - NLP (m/f/d)
Description:
üé§ Why voize? Because we‚Äôre more than just a job!

At voize, we‚Äôre revolutionizing the healthcare industry with AI: Nurses simply speak their documentation into their smartphones, and our AI automatically generates the correct entries. This saves each nurse an average of 39 minutes per day, improves the quality of documentation, and makes their daily work much more rewarding.

voize is YCombinator-funded, already in use at over 600 senior care homes, and has grown by 100% in the last 90 days. Our customers save over 3.5 million hours annually ‚Äì time spent on people instead of paperwork.

But this is just the beginning. With our self-developed voize AI, we‚Äôre transforming not only the healthcare industry, but also have the potential to create value in many other sectors ‚Äì from healthcare to inspections.

üí° Your Mission

If you're a Senior Machine Learning Engineer experienced with NLP and are excited to work at the cutting edge of product design, applied ML research, and MLOps, then go ahead and apply! With us, you'll build products with direct user feedback, train AI models with real data, and ship new features to production every day.

ü§ù Your Skillset ‚Äì What You Bring To The Table


Several years experience shipping models (LLMs) into production
Significant experience with deep learning frameworks (preferably PyTorch)
Proven capability training new models from scratch
Experience in speech recognition or NLP & transformer models (TTS, STT)
Engineering excellence with CI/CD for example Docker, Kubernetes
Nice to have: German language skills would be a bonus


üöÄ Your Daily Business ‚Äì No two days are alike


Take ownership for the design, training, evaluation, and deployment of our deep learning models in the space of speech recognition and NLP
The models you build and refine are at the heart of our applications and directly impact the end-user
You'll get to engineer large self-supervised trainings as well as fast inference for mobile devices and hosted environments


üéØ Our Success Mindset ‚Äì How we work at voize


Resilience is one of your strengths ‚Äì you see challenges as opportunities, not obstacles
Iterative working suits you ‚Äì you test, learn, and improve constantly instead of waiting for perfection
Communication & feedback come naturally to you ‚Äì you openly address issues and both give and receive constructive feedback


üå± Growing together ‚Äì what you can expect at voize


Become a co-creator of our success with virtual stock options
Our office is in Berlin, and we offer remote work
We provide flexible working hours because you know best when you work most efficiently!
Access to various learning platforms (e.g., Blinkist, Audible, etc.)
We have an open culture and organize regular work weeks and team events to collaborate and bond
We are a fast-growing startup, so you'll encounter various challenges, providing the perfect foundation for rapid personal growth
Your work will make a real impact, helping alleviate the workload for healthcare professionals
Free Germany Ticket and Urban Sports Club membership
30 days of vacation ‚Äì plus your birthday off


‚ú® Ready to talk? Apply now! üöÄ

We look forward to your application and can‚Äôt wait to meet you ‚Äì no matter who you are or what background you have!

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Experimentation Platform
Description:
Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of data-driven decision-making?

Bolt's Experimentation Platform team is seeking a Senior Data Scientist to spearhead innovation in hypothesis testing and causal inference across the company.

About Us

With over 200 million customers in 50+ countries, Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa. And it's all thanks to our people.

We believe in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is welcome, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, or disability.

Our ultimate goal is to make cities for people, not cars, and we need your help to achieve this mission!

About The Role

Our mission is to build a world-class experimentation ecosystem. You will be at the forefront, researching cutting-edge methodologies, building proofs-of-concept (PoCs), and collaborating to bring these innovations to life. Your initial focus will be on critical projects like improving our test design methodology and rolling out ML-powered variance reduction methods into production. Future areas of exploration include advanced holdout strategies, sequential testing, variance reduction techniques, and estimating treatment effects in marketplace experiments.

This role is ideal for you if you‚Äôre interested in a mix of technical work and collaboration, and working on a diverse range of interesting problems across the company. If you think you fit this profile, but are unsure about whether you meet other criteria, please apply, and we can discuss!

Main tasks and responsibilities:


Research, prototype, and validate novel statistical methods for A/B testing and causal inference relevant to Bolt's challenges.
Develop PoCs for new methodologies, working closely with our two dedicated data engineers to support moving successful concepts into production.
Drive the democratization of experimentation by improving self-serve tooling, developing educational materials, and providing direct consultation to product teams.
Collaborate closely with engineers and product managers to translate advanced statistical methods into robust, scalable platform features used by hundreds of people across Bolt.
Work closely with Data Science and Analyst teams across all verticals to prioritize your research agenda and drive experimentation best practices throughout the company.
Effectively communicate complex statistical concepts and experiment results to stakeholders of different levels of data literacy when needed, from Data Scientists and Analysts, to Product Managers, Engineers, and leadership.



About you:


2+ years of experience working in the tech industry in a Data Scientist/Analyst or Economist role
Be able to translate novel methods from research papers on experimentation and causal inference into PoCs.
Deep understanding and practical application of Statistical Hypothesis Testing and A/B Testing / Randomized Controlled Trials (including advanced techniques).
Strong stakeholder management skills, notably collaborating with and influencing Data Scientists and Analysts.
Proficiency in R or Python (we work in Python, but this can be acquired) and SQL.
Practical experience with Computational Statistics techniques (e.g., Simulation, Bootstrapping, Bayesian methods) is huge plus.
We appreciate your proven experience in selecting and practically applying appropriate Causal Inference methods (e.g., Diff-in-Diff, instrumental variables) based on data constraints



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don‚Äôt tick every box, please consider applying!

Why you‚Äôll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50+ countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode with a minimum of 3 days in the office each week to foster strong connections and teamwork.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location and role.
Show more

Description:
Die Technopolis Group ist ein internationales Forschungs- und Beratungsunternehmen f√ºr den √∂ffentlichen Sektor mit √ºber 300 Kolleg*innen an zw√∂lf Standorten in Europa, Afrika und Lateinamerika. Wir begleiten ‚Äì oft als externe Evaluator*innen ‚Äì Politikinstrumente wie z.B. F√∂rderprogramme in verschiedenen Themenfeldern. Bundes- und Landesministerien oder die Europ√§ische Kommission).

Zur Verst√§rkung unserer Data Science Unit (DSU) suchen wir eine*n erfahrene*n enthusiastische*n Policy Data Scientist f√ºr die evidenzbasierte Politikberatung mit datenwissenschaftlichen Methoden. Das zehnk√∂pfige Team der DSU ist √ºber mehrere internationale Technopolis-Standorte verteilt und vereint diverse akademische Hintergr√ºnde wie Astrophysik, Wirtschaft, Psychologie, Management und Statistik. Wir f√∂rdern Offenheit, Zusammenarbeit und Vielfalt und teilen die Leidenschaft, Data-Science-Anwendungen f√ºr die evidenzbasierte Politikberatung zu entwickeln.

Neben der Politikberatung betreibt die DSU auch eigene Forschung und Entwicklung im Bereich innovativer Datenanwendungen. Unser Fokus liegt dabei auf Datenkonsolidierung (z. B. via API), automatisierter Analyse strukturierter und unstrukturierter Daten, Klassifikation, Sentiment-Analyse sowie Datenvisualisierung. Wir setzen auf Methoden wie Record Linkage, Klassifikatoren, Web Scraping und dynamische Visualisierungen und unsere aktuellen Schwerpunkte umfassen Echtzeitindikatoren, kausale KI und generative KI. Erfahrung oder Lernbereitschaft in diesen Bereichen ist daher besonders w√ºnschenswert.

Durchf√ºhrung von Analysen unter Verwendung von Python und anderen Data Science-Tools
Extraktion und Transformation von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen sowie Entwicklung von Prozessen f√ºr Datenbereinigung, -integration und -validierung

Erstellung von adressatengerechten Berichten und Pr√§sentationen

Mindestens zwei Jahre einschl√§gige Berufserfahrung in der Anwendung fortgeschrittener datenwissenschaftlicher Methoden (√ºber grundlegende Statistik/√ñkonometrie hinausgehend) im Public Policy Kontext

Sehr gute Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch, weitere Sprachen von Vorteil

Allgemeines Verst√§ndnis des Bereichs Wissenschaft, Technologie und Innovation sowie Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit mit politischen Entscheidungstr√§gern und Kenntnisse im Umgang mit wirtschaftlichen und innovationsbezogenen Daten

Wir bieten durch die enge Projektzusammenarbeit mit √∂ffentlichen Institutionen ein sinnstiftendes und gesellschaftlich wirkungsvolles Arbeitsumfeld
Als innovatives Unternehmen f√∂rdern wir die Weiterentwicklung unserer Mitarbeitenden √ºber interne und externe Fortbildungsangebote. Wir f√∂rdern Selbstst√§ndigkeit und Eigeninitiative f√ºr den Ausbau und die Weiterentwicklung unserer Aktivit√§ten durch flache Hierarchien und eine offene Unternehmenskultur
Wir erm√∂glichen eine flexible Arbeitsweise (reduzierte Stundenzahl, Gleitzeit) mit attraktiven Arbeitspl√§tzen in unseren B√ºros in Berlin oder Frankfurt/M. sowie Home-Office-M√∂glichkeiten durch mobilf√§hige Ausstattung (MacBook & iPhone)
Wir legen Wert auf eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosph√§re und leben dies z.B. durch regelm√§√üige Teamevents, inkl. Events aller Kolleg*innen der Technopolis-B√ºros weltweit. Wir pflegen intensiv den Austausch mit unseren Schwesterb√ºros in Europa, Afrika und Lateinamerika
Technopolis ist ausschlie√ülich in Besitz der Mitarbeitenden, externe Investoren gibt es bei uns nicht. Perspektivisch k√∂nnen alle Mitarbeitende Anteilseigner*innen der Technopolis Group werden. Unabh√§ngig hiervon partizipiert unser gesamtes Team regelm√§√üig am Unternehmenserfolg
Wir bieten eine unbefristete Anstellung in einem wachsenden Unternehmen. Zusch√ºsse zur Nutzung umweltfreundlicher Mobilit√§tsarten (√ñPNV oder Jobrad), f√ºr eine Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft sowie die betriebliche Altersversorgung runden das Angebot ab


Weiteres Verfahren

Auch wenn Sie nicht alle Anforderungen komplett erf√ºllen, bewerben Sie sich gerne. Vielleicht sind genau Sie die richtige Person f√ºr uns. Wir wertsch√§tzen Vielfalt und begr√º√üen daher alle Bewerbungen ‚Äì unabh√§ngig von Geschlecht, Nationalit√§t, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identit√§t.

Wir freuen uns darauf, Sie kennenzulernen! Bitte laden Sie Ihre deutschsprachige Bewerbung (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf ohne Foto, Arbeitszeugnisse sowie in einer PDF unter "Andere" zusammengefasst relevante Hochschulzeugnisse und jeweils eine deutsche und englische Textprobe) auf unserer Webseite unter Angabe Ihrer Standortpr√§ferenz und Gehaltsvorstellung sowie Wunscharbeitszeit hoch.

F√ºr Fragen wenden Sie sich bitte an unsere Recruiting Managerin Susann Reinsch (susann.reinsch_AT_technopolis-group.com).

Bewerbungsschluss ist der 25. Mai 2025. Bewerbungsgespr√§che k√∂nnen bereits vor Bewerbungsschluss gef√ºhrt werden.

  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in Python sind erforderlich, Kenntnisse in SQL und R von Vorteil
  • Sehr gute Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch, weitere Sprachen von Vorteil
  • Erfahrung mit offenen Datenquellen, GitHub, der Konsolidierung von Datenbanken, Datenverarbeitung und Web Scraping
  • Gute Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten und die F√§higkeit, in einem internationalen und multikulturellen Umfeld zu arbeiten
  • W√ºnschenswerte Erfahrungen und Kompetenzen:
    • Erfahrung mit NLP (Natural Language Processing) und Wissensextraktion
    • Kenntnisse und Interesse an Machine-Learning-Methoden zur Annotation und Wissensextraktion
    • Allgemeines Verst√§ndnis des Bereichs Wissenschaft, Technologie und Innovation sowie Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit mit politischen Entscheidungstr√§gern und Kenntnisse im Umgang mit wirtschaftlichen und innovationsbezogenen Daten
Unser Angebot

  • Wir bieten durch die enge Projektzusammenarbeit mit √∂ffentlichen Institutionen ein sinnstiftendes und gesellschaftlich wirkungsvolles Arbeitsumfeld
  • Als innovatives Unternehmen f√∂rdern wir die Weiterentwicklung unserer Mitarbeitenden √ºber interne und externe Fortbildungsangebote. Wir f√∂rdern Selbstst√§ndigkeit und Eigeninitiative f√ºr den Ausbau und die Weiterentwicklung unserer Aktivit√§ten durch flache Hierarchien und eine offene Unternehmenskultur
  • Wir erm√∂glichen eine flexible Arbeitsweise (reduzierte Stundenzahl, Gleitzeit) mit attraktiven Arbeitspl√§tzen in unseren B√ºros in Berlin oder Frankfurt/M. sowie Home-Office-M√∂glichkeiten durch mobilf√§hige Ausstattung (MacBook & iPhone)
  • Wir legen Wert auf eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosph√§re und leben dies z.B. durch regelm√§√üige Teamevents, inkl. Events aller Kolleg*innen der Technopolis-B√ºros weltweit. Wir pflegen intensiv den Austausch mit unseren Schwesterb√ºros in Europa, Afrika und Lateinamerika
  • Technopolis ist ausschlie√ülich in Besitz der Mitarbeitenden, externe Investoren gibt es bei uns nicht. Perspektivisch k√∂nnen alle Mitarbeitende Anteilseigner*innen der Technopolis Group werden. Unabh√§ngig hiervon partizipiert unser gesamtes Team regelm√§√üig am Unternehmenserfolg
  • Wir bieten eine unbefristete Anstellung in einem wachsenden Unternehmen. Zusch√ºsse zur Nutzung umweltfreundlicher Mobilit√§tsarten (√ñPNV oder Jobrad), f√ºr eine Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft sowie die betriebliche Altersversorgung runden das Angebot ab

Weiteres Verfahren

Auch wenn Sie nicht alle Anforderungen komplett erf√ºllen, bewerben Sie sich gerne. Vielleicht sind genau Sie die richtige Person f√ºr uns. Wir wertsch√§tzen Vielfalt und begr√º√üen daher alle Bewerbungen ‚Äì unabh√§ngig von Geschlecht, Nationalit√§t, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identit√§t.

Wir freuen uns darauf, Sie kennenzulernen! Bitte laden Sie Ihre deutschsprachige Bewerbung (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf ohne Foto, Arbeitszeugnisse sowie in einer PDF unter "Andere" zusammengefasst relevante Hochschulzeugnisse und jeweils eine deutsche und englische Textprobe) auf unserer Webseite unter Angabe Ihrer Standortpr√§ferenz und Gehaltsvorstellung sowie Wunscharbeitszeit hoch.

F√ºr Fragen wenden Sie sich bitte an unsere Recruiting Managerin Susann Reinsch (susann.reinsch_AT_technopolis-group.com).

Bewerbungsschluss ist der 25. Mai 2025. Bewerbungsgespr√§che k√∂nnen bereits vor Bewerbungsschluss gef√ºhrt werden.

√úber uns

Die Technopolis Group ist ein internationales Forschungs- und Beratungsunternehmen mit uÃàber 300 Politikberater*innen in zw√∂lf Standorten in Europa sowie in Afrika und Lateinamerika. Wir gestalten, implementieren und evaluieren Politikprogramme mit dem Schwerpunkt Forschung und Innovation fuÃàr regionale, nationale und internationale Organisationen des √∂ffentlichen Sektors.

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist (Analytics), Consumer, Core Experience
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About Consumer Analytics At Wolt

As the name Consumer Analytics implies, this team aims to provide reliable data insights that drive informed decision-making, empower Wolt's product organization, and foster a data-driven culture through collaboration and education, ultimately inspiring teams and building value for the Consumer group.

About The Core Experience Team

Core Consumer Experience Analytics team takes care of the core customer journey at Wolt from opening the app to placing the order, including all of the steps in between: browsing, search, in-venue experience, cart and checkout. Data Scientists in this team collaborate closely with product teams, supporting decision-making with insights and experimentation.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using analytics to affect the customer journey at Wolt, we're looking for someone like you!

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working ‚Äî a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. üíô Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don‚Äôt learn, we won‚Äôt stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda‚Äôs greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 3 years of experience in a Data Analyst or Data Scientist position.
Experience working with product funnels and user journeys.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing (A/B testing), and experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.


Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com) or Jaksa Marojevic (jaksa.marojevic@external.wotl.com)

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
Show more

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Scientist and Research Software Engineer (f/m/d) (Ref. 25/05)
Description:
The Weierstrass Institute for Applied Analysis and Stochastics (WIAS) is an institute of the Forschungsverbund Berlin e.V. (FVB). The FVB comprises seven non-university research institutes in Berlin which are funded by the federal and state governments. The research institutes belong to the Leibniz Association.

WIAS invites applications as

Scientist and Research Software Engineer (f/m/d)

(Ref. 25/05)

in the Research Group

‚ÄúNumerical Mathematics and Scientific ComputingNumerical Mathematics and Scientific Computing‚Äú

(Head: Prof. Dr. V. John) starting as soon as possible.

The work tasks include: active research in the topics of numerical simulations for problems from applications, especially those which are studied in the research group (e.g., in connection with fluid mechanics, biomedical applications, semiconductors or electro-chemistry). In addition, it is expected that the staff of the institute is supported in the development and publication of scientific software, e.g., by organizing appropriate qualification measures.

We are looking for: Applicants should have relevant scientific publications and experience in the development numerical methods for application-oriented problems, of the implementation of scientific software or open-source software and a good knowledge of modern software development methods, such as version control, continuous integration and documentation tools. The successful candidate is expected to support projects from the above mentioned applications in cooperation with partners inside and outside WIAS, to contribute to WIAS software development, and be willing to provide instruction and training to scientists (also in English).

A university diploma or master degree in mathematics or a closely related discipline as well as a PhD degree are required.

What we offer:


WIAS Berlin is a premier research institution known for its strength in optimization, optimal control, dynamical systems, and applied mathematics in general.
Mobile working
A certified (Audit berufundfamilie) family-friendly work environment.
Berlin is one of the most culture-rich and diverse international cities in the world. It offers endless opportunities to enjoy life outside work, while being very affordable compared to other major cities. Neither the job nor living in Berlin requires German language (although WIAS offers free German courses). We highly welcome international applications. Scientifically, Berlin offers a rich landscape with numerous opportunities for research, as well as job prospects in academia and industry.


Technical queries should be directed to Prof. Dr. V. John (john@wias-berlin).

The working hours are 39 hours per week and the position is remunerated according to TVoeD Bund and is initially limited to three years.

The Weierstra√ü Institute is an equal opportunity employer. We explicitly encourage female researchers to apply for the offered position. Among equally qualified applicants, disabled candidates will be given preference.

Please upload complete application documents including cover letter, curriculum vitae, certificates, and a copy of your Ph.D. thesis (or relevant publications) via our online job-application facility until April 30, 2025 using the button ‚ÄúApply online‚Äù.

We are looking forward to your application!

Erwartet wird die Mitarbeit in Projekten aus o.g. Anwendungen in Kooperation mit Partnern innerhalb und au√üerhalb des WIAS, in der Software-Entwicklung des WIAS und die Bereitschaft zur Anleitung und Schulung von Wissenschaftler:innen (auch in englischer Sprache).

Ein Hochschulabschluss in Mathematik (Diplom oder Master) oder in einer eng verwandten Disziplin sowie eine abgeschlossene Promotion sind erforderlich.

Das WIAS Berlin ist eine f√ºhrende Forschungseinrichtung, die f√ºr ihre St√§rken in Bereichen wie Mathematische Modellierung, Optimierung, dynamische Systeme und angewandte Mathematik im Allgemeinen bekannt ist.
Bezahlung nach dem Tarifvertrag f√ºr den √∂ffentlichen Dienst (TV√∂D Bund) einschlie√ülich der √ºblichen Sozialleistungen (30 Urlaubstage in der 5-Tage-Woche, betriebliche Altersvorsorge); Zuschuss zum Firmenticket f√ºr den √ñPNV
Mobiles Arbeiten
Ein zertifiziertes (Audit berufundfamilie) familienfreundliches Arbeitsumfeld.
Berlin bietet unendlich viele M√∂glichkeiten, das Leben au√üerhalb der Arbeit zu genie√üen. Weder f√ºr die Arbeit noch f√ºr das Leben in Berlin sind deutsche Sprachkenntnisse erforderlich (obwohl das WIAS kostenlose Deutschkurse anbietet). Internationale Bewerbungen sind uns sehr willkommen. In wissenschaftlicher Hinsicht bietet Berlin eine reichhaltige Landschaft mit zahlreichen M√∂glichkeiten f√ºr die Forschung sowie Jobperspektiven in Wissenschaft und Industrie.


Fachliche R√ºckfragen sind an Prof. Dr. Volker John (volker.john@wias-berlin.de) zu richten.

Die Stelle wird nach TV√∂D verg√ºtet wird und ist zun√§chst auf 3 Jahre befristet. Die Arbeitszeit betr√§gt insgesamt 39 Wochenstunden.

In Anbetracht der angestrebten Erh√∂hung des Frauenanteils im Wissenschaftsbereich sind Bewerbungen qualifizierter Interessentinnen besonders willkommen. Schwerbehinderte werden bei gleicher Qualifikation bevorzugt.

Bitte laden Sie Ihre vollst√§ndigen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit Anschreiben, Lebenslauf, Zeugnissen bis zum 30. April 2025 √ºber unser Bewerber-Portal hoch, indem Sie den Button ‚ÄûOnline bewerben‚Äú klicken.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Our client is a leading provider of innovative workforce solutions, using data and AI to help organisations better understand and optimise their people strategies. From transforming how companies approach internal planning to enabling self-service insights through conversational analytics, they are redefining how businesses understand and manage their workforce. With a strong foundation of industry expertise and a focus on continuous innovation, they are committed to driving ongoing success.




What To Expect:

You will collaborate cross functionally with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and implement solutions that drive new product development and unlock meaningful data insights. Working with vast datasets, you will research and develop advanced statistical models‚Äîsuch as hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and machine learning‚Äîand implement and test algorithms at a production level.




Requirements:

Masters or PHD in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or Statistics
5+ years experience as a Data Scientist
Proficient in Python and SQL
Experience working on Natural Language Processing methods (preferred)
On Site in Berlin
Excellent communication in English
Show more
HTML:
Our client is a leading provider of innovative workforce solutions, using data and AI to help organisations better understand and optimise their people strategies. From transforming how companies approach internal planning to enabling self-service insights through conversational analytics, they are redefining how businesses understand and manage their workforce. With a strong foundation of industry expertise and a focus on continuous innovation, they are committed to driving ongoing success.


What To Expect:

You will collaborate cross functionally with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and implement solutions that drive new product development and unlock meaningful data insights. Working with vast datasets, you will research and develop advanced statistical models‚Äîsuch as hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and machine learning‚Äîand implement and test algorithms at a production level.


Requirements:

  • Masters or PHD in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or Statistics
  • 5+ years experience as a Data Scientist
  • Proficient in Python and SQL
  • Experience working on Natural Language Processing methods (preferred)
  • On Site in Berlin
  • Excellent communication in English

Title: Research Engineering Intern
Description:
Deep learning has only just started its transformative impact on the natural sciences. In Microsoft Research AI for Science we are seeking to solve some of the fundamental challenges in the molecular sciences with deep learning.

We are seeking a highly motivated Research Engineering Intern. The ideal candidate will have an understanding of machine learning and/or language modelling fundamentals, and will work on language modelling within the context of natural sciences.

Responsibilities


Architect, design, and implement scalable and robust solutions for machine learning and scientific research involving large volumes of heterogeneous data.
Build and optimize distributed data processing and model building pipelines.
Develop and maintain tools and technologies for building, training, optimizing, scaling machine learning solutions


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ


Working towards a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master's degree or equivalent work experience in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Chemistry, Mathematics or a related field.
Strong familiarity with Linux and the open-source ecosystem
Experience with scientific computing


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience with cloud computing or HPC is a plus
Experience with language modelling is a plus


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Junior AI Solutions Engineer
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world‚Äôs leading sexual wellbeing company, with the mission to elevate pleasure through innovative technologies, a data-driven approach, and foster creative and fresh perspectives on intimacy. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a streamlined online shopping experience.

At Lovehoney, we employ over 800 passionate and progressive individuals across 9 global offices, each person contributing a unique blend of talents to our diverse workforce. We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers‚Äô lives.

Join us at Lovehoney, where pleasure combines with creativity, data, and innovation!

We are currently looking for a Junior ML Scientist who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Partnering directly with the Head of AI, your focus will be on developing AI Applications. In this role, you will combine your appreciation for Technology with your capacity for creative AI Solutions. You will develop skills crucial to advancing in a competitive, fast-paced retail sector, all within a company that prizes dedication and results.

What You Will Do


Craft Next-Level AI Solutions



Design, build, and optimise advanced LLM pipelines, emphasizing prompt engineering and chain-of-thought methodologies.

Actively research, prototype, and integrate new techniques to enhance LLM performance across real-world use cases.


Automate Business Processes



Develop automated workflows and AI agents using n8n.io (or similar platforms like Make), streamlining and optimizing key business processes.

Efficiently automate routine tasks, creating practical and reliable solutions that save time and resources.


AI Applications



Move swiftly from prototypes to tangible AI products, ensuring your work has immediate, measurable impact on business operations and customer experiences.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to manage AI project lifecycles from concept to deployment, demonstrating strong project management skills.

What You Should Bring


Python & ML Framework Proficiency



Excellent programming skills in Python.

Hands-on experience with popular machine learning frameworks, especially LangChain or LlamaIndex.


AI-Assisted Coding



Practical experience with AI-enhanced IDEs‚Äîparticularly Cursor.

A commitment to innovative coding practices (‚Äúvibe coding‚Äù) and continuous improvement of your development workflow.


Automation & Workflow Expertise ( n8n.io )



Hands-on experience building automation workflows using n8n.io (or Make/Copilot Studio).

Ability to enhance productivity and drive process improvements through well-designed automation solutions.


Database & API Skills



Solid experience working with standard databases (Redis, SQL/NoSQL).

Proficiency in retrieving, cleaning, transforming, and managing data via APIs for analytics and AI-driven applications.


Continuous Learner & Active Consumer of AI Content



You stay on top of the rapidly evolving AI landscape by actively consuming and engaging with content on platforms like X (Twitter), YouTube, and industry blogs.

Eagerness to translate new findings into actionable, real-world improvements.


Passion for AI‚Äôs Business Impact



A genuine excitement for the potential of AI to transform business processes.

Ability to quickly turn cutting-edge ideas into tangible, impactful solutions for internal operations and customer-facing products.

What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, friendly faces and fun team-building events
Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers, in addition to a 50% discount on all Lovehoney products to explore and discover new ways to have fun
Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days‚Äô holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration
Access to customised training opportunities to support your unique learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles, offering valuable insights into your performance and growth areas, enhancing your development within the company.
Recognising the significance of physical and mental health, we proudly provide gym benefits in addition to a mental wellbeing platform, to ensure our employees thrive both professionally and personally.



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritize transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data Scientist, Traveler
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

At GetYourGuide (GYG), we're looking for a passionate Data Scientist to join our Traveler Data Products Team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our product and our customers' experiences. You'll work with a vast and diverse set of structured and unstructured data, powering various data products such as search, recommendations, SEM, and incentives. Our team has touchpoints across the business, developing end-to-end solutions that directly contribute to creating memorable travel experiences for people around the world.

Join the Traveler Data Products Team, where we are passionate about creating data-driven solutions that empower travelers to discover and connect with the perfect experiences. Our mission is to make our vast inventory accessible and relevant by tailoring it to individual interests, extracting valuable insights from product descriptions, and customizing page layouts to meet our users' unique needs. We are also at the forefront of exploring how Large Language Models (LLMs) can accelerate the discovery of relevant products, ensuring a seamless and enriching customer journey.

As a valued member of our inclusive and dynamic team, you will collaborate closely with fellow Data Scientists and MLOps Engineers, continuously innovating to enhance the relevance and personalization of the products we display. Together, we strive to make every travel experience unforgettable.

You Will


Develop innovative data products that not only delight our customers but also drive the success of our company.
Take full ownership of projects, guiding them from the initial business challenge to the deployment of production code. This includes:
Contribute to the development of our machine learning infrastructure and help establish best practices that will shape our future.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, leveraging your unique perspective to solve complex and exciting problems.
Support the continuous improvement and growth of our team, including participating in recruiting efforts to bring in new talent.


Who You Are

Ideal candidates will have 2+ years experience in a full time role, covering most of the following areas:


Machine Learning Familiarity with regressors, classifiers, and recommender systems. A solid understanding of ML techniques and their practical applications. Experience deploying ML models in production is a plus.
Software Engineering Proficiency in Python. Knowledge of distributed machine learning and computing frameworks (e.g., Spark) is beneficial.
Analytics Ability to transform data into actionable insights. Experience with hypothesis testing and proficiency in analytics tools (e.g., pandas, R) and SQL.
Business Acumen Applied experience in a business environment, demonstrating result-driven work.
Academic Background An advanced degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
Communication Strong skills in explaining complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


We value potential and enthusiasm as much as experience. If you are passionate about data science and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet all the criteria listed above.

How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Scientist - Consumer (Global Discovery)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist to join the Search & Ranking team within consumer discovery on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.


Develop and Optimize Search Algorithms: Enhance and research new search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization, to deliver the most relevant results to our users.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work as part of a cross-functional team, including Backend Engineers, Product Managers, and Data Engineers, to improve our global search end-2-end.
Analyze and interpret large datasets: Extract meaningful insights to understand relevance problems.
Innovate and Experiment: Identify and apply the best machine learning and statistical methods to solve complex problems, ensuring solutions are scalable and effective in production environments.
Navigate Ambiguity: Define and tackle data science problems amidst ambiguity, ensuring clear problem definitions and actionable insights


At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

What you need to be successful


Experience: Master‚Äôs degree (or Bachelor‚Äôs with 4+ years of work experience) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Theoretical Chemistry, or similar. 2+ years of experience as a data scientist working on applying data science fundamentals to solve complex business problems
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in SQL and Python and its ML ecosystem is essential. Experience with Java and Scala is a plus.
Machine Learning Knowledge: Strong understanding of a wide variety of ML and statistical methods, including Classical ML, Deep Learning, NLP, and Recommendation Systems. Ability to discern the most suitable approach for different problems.
Search and Ranking ML Algorithms: Hands-on experience with search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization.
Problem-Solving: Comfortable with ambiguity and capable of navigating it to define clear data science problems and solutions. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering practical solutions.
Collaborative Spirit: Proven experience working in cross-functional teams, contributing effectively to joint projects and achieving common goals. Excellent communication skills to articulate complex ideas and influence stakeholders.


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Scientist (w/m/d)
Description:
About

Title: Senior Data Scientist - AI Agents & Generative AI (f/m/d)*
Description:
Your Mission

As a Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)*, you will evaluate and improve the performance of our AI Agents. This will involve developing evaluation tasks for agent behaviour, fine-tuning foundation models, researching and prototyping new AI Agent features and frameworks, and investigating issues affecting our customers. You‚Äôll develop a deep understanding of the behaviour of our models and AI Agents. You‚Äôll work directly with product engineering and sales teams, leading by example on evaluating and improving our product - from testing new AI system optimisation frameworks to fine-tuning STT models on new languages and accents.

You‚Äôll join the AI & Data Science Team, a collaborative group of Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists that own Parloa‚Äôs ML Evaluation Platform and the machine learning models that power our product. The team is responsible for keeping Parloa at the forefront of research and development of Generative AI and AI Agent based products.

In This Role You Will


Take ownership of data science and machine learning projects that help us improve our generative AI product suite
Develop and evaluate production Agentic AI systems for real customer use cases
Directly support and collaborate with product engineering and sales, analyzing the performance of our AI products and prototyping new features
Evaluate and train or fine-tune a variety of models, including LLMs, intent classification, STT, and TTS models
Execute Machine Learning research and development projects end-to-end, rapidly turning new ideas into customer facing features


Our Tech stack (AI & Data): Python, OpenAI, LangGraph, SQL, Microsoft Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Eventhubs (Kafka), PostHog, Databricks, DeltaLiveTables, Preset

What You Bring To The Table


7+ years of experience as a Data Scientist
Experience developing and owning production ML models and systems. Experience with LLMs, NLP, or information retrieval is a strong plus
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with using using Python in production
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark) and using ML Ops platforms (e.g. MLFlow)
Experience with owning the ML process end-to-end: from gathering requirements to experimentation to productionisation, monitoring and optimization.
Experience in leading medium-sized technical projects (3-9 months roadmap)
Strong spoken and written communication skills in English


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?


Be part of a dynamic, driven team of +40 nationalities with flat hierarchies and a collaborative company culture
Flexible office policy - we believe in hiring the best talent, no matter where they are based. However, we love to build real connections and want to welcome everyone in the office
Attractive compensation package
Training and development budget which can be used for conferences and attending development courses to ensure continuous professional growth
Flexible working hours, 28 vacation days and workation opportunities
Enjoy unlimited access to a variety of fitness, yoga, and leisure activities via Wellpass or Urban Sport Club.
We cover the cost of a monthly Deutschland train ticket.
Leverage exclusive offers with our corporate benefits portal, giving you access to compelling deals from leading brands.
Regular team events, game nights, and other social activities
And last but not least: a beautiful office with flair in the heart of Berlin with all the conveniences, such as adjustable desks, social area, fresh fruits, cereals and drinks
Is something missing here? Reach out and let's talk about what else you need for your ideal next growth opportunity


Your Recruiting Process At Parloa

Recruiter video call ‚Üí Hiring Manager Interview ‚Üí Technical Stage 1 (Data Science Coding Session) ‚Üí Technical Stage 2 (Machine Learning Theory & Case Study) ‚Üí Meeting the team

Why Parloa?

Parloa is one of the fastest growing startups in the world of Generative AI and customer service. Parloa‚Äôs voice-first GenAI platform for contact centers is built on the best AI technology to automate customer service with natural-sounding conversations for outstanding experiences on all communication channels. Leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, Parloa creates intelligent phone and chat solutions for businesses that turn contact centers into value centers by boosting customer service efficiency. The Parloa platform resolves the majority of customer queries quickly and automatically, allowing human agents to focus on complex issues and relationships. Parloa was founded in 2018 by Malte Kosub and Stefan Ostwald and today employs over 250 people in Berlin, Munich, and New York.

When you join Parloa, you become part of a dynamic and innovative team made up of over 34 nationalities that‚Äôs revolutionizing an entire industry. We‚Äôre passionate about growing together and creating opportunities for personal and professional development. With our recent $66 million Series B investment, we‚Äôre expanding globally and looking for talented individuals to join us on this exciting journey.

Do you have questions about Parloa, the role, or our team before you apply? Please feel free to get in touch with our Hiring Team.

Parloa is committed to upholding the highest data protection standards for our clients' and employees' data. All our employees are instrumental in ensuring the utmost care, GDPR, and ISO compliance, including ISO 27001, in handling sensitive information.


We provide equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, national origin, disability status, socioeconomic background and other characteristics.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
What We Do

Merantix Momentum is a Berlin-based AI startup focusing on accelerating AI adoption across many industries through B2B solutions, as well as publicly funded research projects. We work across several domains, including manufacturing, healthcare, the German public sector, and many more, transforming businesses as an external machine learning department. We achieve this using our core expertise in state-of-the-art machine learning combined with our culture of rapid iterations to build scalable solutions.

Your role

Are you passionate about developing impactful applications of Machine Learning? The mission of this role is to bring state-of-the-art deep-learning methods to real-world applications from ideation and prototyping to production.

These Will Be Your Main Responsibilities


Leading major projects
Scope machine learning projects and their technical feasibility through client interaction
Contribute to the next generation AI stack and grow the open source ecosystem
Collaborate with data-, backend-, and frontend engineers in order to build production-ready AI solutions
Implement machine learning methods and apply them to real-world use cases


Your profile

The ideal candidate is proficient in software engineering and the latest machine- and deep-learning technologies, while also having a solid understanding of machine learning theory and fundamentals. You will independently scope, plan, manage, and drive machine learning projects from the ideation to the production phase - with a particular focus on Natural Language Processing.

You are a great fit for our team if this describes you:


MSc/PhD in computer science, machine learning, or related technical field
Relevant programming skills in Python and experience with libraries like PyTorch
Deep understanding of machine learning principles with hands-on experience training and fine-tuning neural networks
Appreciation for sound engineering practices like version control, clean code, code review, testing, CI/CD, and automation.
Ability to interact with clients, to understand their problems, and to design as well as to explain complex technical solutions
Fluency in English and German


What We Offer

Engaging Topics and Excellence: We offer unique insights into applied machine learning research and development, working with a group of highly talented engineers and entrepreneurs.


International Team: We are a dynamic and international team.
We offer Visa Sponsorship.
Learning and Development: We provide an annual learning and development budget for attending conferences or purchasing educational resources to further develop our employees‚Äô skills. We also hold weekly and monthly events around AI innovation and implementation.
Dynamic and open Working Culture: We have a very flat hierarchy, open 360¬∞ feedback, and flexibility in our work-from-home policy as well as working hours.
AI Ethics: We are committed to developing ethical AI software and actively foster open discussions on this topic within our team.
Brand new office space: Bright and open office situated on the AI Campus in Berlin.
Hardware allowance: We give you support to have all the equipment you would need to thrive on your job.
Sabbatical Leave;
Employee benefits: We offer a monthly allowance per employee that can be allocated as desired to one of the following: Mobility & transportation (NAVIT), sports (Urban Sports Club) or groceries (Edenred).


About Us

We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity. We consider all applications equally regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. We strongly encourage individuals from groups traditionally underrepresented in tech to apply, and we can help with immigration.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Python - AI / Supply Chain
Description:
Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Berlin (Hybrid or Remote within Germany)

Job Type: Full-time

Industry: AI / Supply Chain Technology

Language Requirements: English (Fluent), German is a +

Salary: ‚Ç¨90,000 - ‚Ç¨120,000




The Company:

My client is an innovative and fast-growing company operating at the intersection of artificial intelligence and supply chain optimisation. With a strong focus on digital transformation and data-driven decision-making, they are developing a platform that helps industrial companies build resilient, transparent supply chains through intelligent, automated insights.




The company is well-funded, already working with recognised names in the industry, and is now scaling its team to support the next phase of growth.




About the Role:

They're looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their high-performing AI team. This is a hands-on role focused on developing, deploying, and maintaining production-grade ML models that power key product features. You‚Äôll work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to build intelligent solutions that solve real-world supply chain challenges.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement scalable ML models for production use
Collaborate with product and data teams to define modelling goals and success metrics
Preprocess and analyse structured and unstructured data
Develop training pipelines, model validation processes, and evaluation frameworks
Deploy models using containerisation tools (e.g. Docker) and cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS, GCP)
Monitor performance and continuously improve model accuracy and efficiency
Write clean, reproducible, and well-documented code




Requirements:

6 years + experience with Python and ML libraries (e.g. scikit-learn, XGBoost, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Proficiency in data manipulation using tools like Pandas, NumPy, and SQL
Experience training and deploying ML models in a production environment
Solid understanding of ML concepts including feature engineering, cross-validation, and model evaluation
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and container tools (Docker, Kubernetes)
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively




Desirable:

Experience working with supply chain or procurement data
Exposure to NLP techniques (e.g. text classification, embeddings, transformers)
Experience with MLOps tools and model monitoring solutions
Background in computer science, data science, applied maths, or a related field




What‚Äôs on Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package
Flexible working hours and a remote-friendly culture
A collaborative, supportive team environment
Opportunities for career development and skill-building
A chance to make a meaningful impact at a forward-thinking company

Show more

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Your Responsibilities

We are looking for a full-time for Python Developer to join in the R&D Bioinformatics team in Berlin, Rostock, Belgrade or Valencia. You will be responsible for developing new pipelines and improving current algorithms.


Guiding the development of diagnostic tools and applications
Implementing new and improving existing features in our software stack
Monitor automated data processing pipelines
Coordinate and plan new diagnostic methods with stakeholders, medical experts, and the diagnostics team
Ensuring a high quality of the developed software and the corresponding documentation


Your profile


At least 5+ years‚Äô experience working with Python and SQL, preferably with background in Biology, Medicine, or Genetics. NGS knowledge is a plus
Experience with python packages: Numpy, Pandas, sqlalchemy, Pydantic, FastAPI, Django and Flask.
Deep understanding of Python-application structure and organization
Experienced with software architecture
Experience with CI/CD Tools and command line (Jenkins, Terraform, Ansible, Git)
Must have experience with scalable cloud environments (AWS preferred).
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills, combined with good team spirit
Ability to set priorities, meet timelines and company objectives.


Why us?


Talents are individually supported by internal and external trainings
An international career in a multicultural environment
Regular company events form us as one team


About Us

With employees from over 50 nations, CENTOGENE is a truly global company located within the university city of Rostock, one of Germany's beautiful cities close to the Baltic sea.

We are dedicated to deliver data-driven, life-changing answers to patients, physicians, and biopharma partners to enable a world healed of rare and neurodegenerative diseases.

In this fast-paced and highly innovative area of biotech, those who want to work, learn, and contribute to a growing biotech company will find a dynamic and exciting environment at CENTOGENE.
